data.title: remove extensions
why isnt this pandac.PandaModules import *
Assimp: Add support for skinned meshes (no animations yet).
data.body:
Here's a first attempt at skinned meshes via Assimp. Some things to note:
- I haven't checked for new memory leaks
- The use of const char\* as a hash key seems kind of ugly, but it also seems like the simplest approach.
- Some NULL checks might be good. An aiBone should have a matching aiNode, but it might be good to protect ourselves if Assimp misbehaves.
- The tbtable->set_rows() could be optimized to leave out non-animated verts

GitHub doesn't like archive files, so I've uploaded one to Dropbox: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3431679/skel_mesh.zip

Inside you'll find:
- animbox.blend -- The original blend file
- animbox.dae -- The COLLADA file exported from Blender using the Better COLLADA plugin
- main.py -- The script to test with

Elapsed Time: 0 sec
Current directory is not the root of the panda tree.
Build terminated.

Could anyone help me ( Also, I'm new here so I may be confused on what to do)

data.title: Send libRocket key events before mouse events
data.body:
On Linux (at least), a key event is accompanied with a mouse position
event.  If a libRocket UI is listening to e.g. "mouseover" events,
then any keypress will first appear to be a mouse movement, tripping
up code that tries to handle focus with both keyboard and mouse
support.

This change merely dispatches key events before any mouse events to
avoid this problem.

data.title: Accept 't' in mode flags and error out if mode unrecognized
data.body: I was using foo = open("...", "rt") and getting unexplained errors ("attempt to read from non-opened file" later on).  So I handle 't' and report a unrecognized file mode.

data.title: makepanda.py: added more refs for PackageMaker
data.body:
PackageMaker isn't as easy to find and download anymore, whatever versions online that are available for download sometimes install the program into Applications/ folder or Developer/Tools/ with the name PackageMaker.app.

This pull request adds two new file paths to check for PackageMaker.app.

data.title: Handle code-driven resizes when WindowProperties::fixed_size is set (alternate attempt)
data.body:
-- X11 seems to send multiple conflicting ConfigureEvents after
resizing a window, so it does not suffice to ignore ConfigureEvents
that change the window size.
-- Instead, do not apply the requested size until we see a ConfigureEvent
for that size.
-- Tested with windowed and fullscreen under xfwm4
-- Added x11display debug logging for resizing in these cases.

-- NOTE: this has the downside that the rejected_properties() will always
list the size request, even when it has been made!

data.title: Handle code-driven resizes when WindowProperties::fixed_size is set.
data.body:
-- X11 seems to send multiple conflicting ConfigureEvents after
resizing a window, so it does not suffice to ignore ConfigureEvents
that change the window size.
-- Instead, record the desired new fixed size and honor a resize
to that size (only).
-- Tested with windowed and fullscreen under xfwm4
-- Added x11display debug logging for resizing in these cases.

makepanda: Add FreeBSD PKGNG support
data.body:
```
- The old FreeBSD package manager is obsolete
for more than an year.
- Added generating of installable package for the new
package manager when '--installer' is invoked
on FreeBSD
```

data.title: Add PNMImage premultiply/unpremultiply methods.
data.body:
Ought to be straightforward, except perhaps the naming of the methods.  Feel free to change them.

(I fought so hard thinking blend_sub_image() or blend() had some bug, and was making all sorts of elaborate fixes and extensions for that, but finally realized it was all my fault, hence these methods :-p.)

data.title: Add pstats star category color
data.body: Now it is distinct from the "App" category in a default configuration.

data.title: Make more keys available to libRocket event handlers
data.body:
Some ASCII chars fell through and generate no events when modifier keys are held down.  E.g. pressing "Ctrl+\" emits neither a 'keydown' nor a 'textinput' event for libRocket.  

libRocket calls several punctuation keys "OEM" in its KeyIdentifier enum, so I assume those were overlooked.  This patch fills those in from Panda's side, assuming a US English keyboard, like libRocket's comments say.  Better that than losing the events entirely...?

data.title: change drive of largeblobsenderconsts
data.body: probably wont get merged but it's worth a shot

data.title: Fix invalid assumptions in GravityWalker
data.body:
The setCollisionRayHeight method assumed that the 0th child on the
avatar would be the av's GeomNode, and again assumed that the 2nd child of
the GeomNode would be this Walker's cRayNode. This is not always the case,
as scene graph manipulations can change the parenting order of nodes.

The fix is to simply pull the cRayNode from the Walker's own cRayNodePath
handle.
